Information.Subtext: How to use the protocol

Interprete.DefaultValue:
To start tracking repositories, add one to the repositories table. This can be done via the context menu or via the add repository page. Both will ask for the repository owner and name, both can be found in the url of the github repository.
By default this element runs without an api key. This means that the element can only sent 60 request per hour before being blocked out by Github. To get more request you can add an api key under General/Configuration page. To generate such a token you can go to Github.com -> Settings -> Developer settings -> Personal access tokens -> tokens (classic), to generate one.

Information.Subtext: The api key retrieved by going to your account settings -> Developer settings -> Personal access tokens -> Tokens (classic)
The Api version this element uses.
The maximum number of request this api key can make in one hour.
The amount of hourly request remaining.
The amount of hourly request already used.
The date time when the rate limit is going to reset again.

Param.Name: GetRepositoryPublicKeyLinkHeader
Param.Description: Get Repository Public Key Link Header

Information.Subtext: The button that trigger an add to the repositories table.
The name of the repository to add.
The owner of the repository to add.
The button that trigger an add to the repositories table.
The organization that holds the repositories.
The button that triggers the creation of the specified workflow to the selected repository.
The repository the workflow needs to be added to.
The branch the workflow needs to be added to.
The workflow you want to add to the selected repository.

Discreet.options: table:selection;confirm:The selected item(s) will be deleted permanently and the repositories will no be tracked anymore.

Information.Subtext: A list of all the tracked repositories.
The full name of the repository.
The name of the repository.
Indicates if the repository is public or private.
The description of the repository.
The owner of the repository
Indicates if the repository is a fork.
The time in UTC when the repository was created.
The time in UTC when the repository was last updated.
The time of the last push to the repository.
The total size of the repository in kilo bytes
The amount of stars the repository has.
The total amount of watchers the repository has.
The main language of the repository.
The default branch of the repository.
The type of the repository
The ID of the public key.
The public key for the repository.
A list of all the tags the tracked repositories have.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
The name of the tag.
The ID of the repository this tag is linked.
The commit ID where the tag was placed on.
A list of all the repository releases.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
The ID of the release.
The name of the tag this release is linked with.
The dataminer id of the tag this release is linked with.
The branch this relaese is targetting.
The name of the release
Indication if this release is a draft or not.
Indication if this release is a pre-release or not.
A description for the release.
The author of this release.
The creation date of the release in UTC time.
The in UTC when the release was publsihed.
The id of the repository this release is linked with.

Param.Name: RepositoryWorkflows_ContextMenu
Param.Description: Context Menu for Repository Workflows Table

Information.Subtext: A list of all the workflows per tracked repository.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
The ID of the repository this workflow is linked.
The name of the workflow.
The state of the workflow
The path to the workflow yaml file.
The datetime when the workflow was created.
The datetime of the last update to the workflow
The datetime when the workflow was deleted.
A list containing all the issues linked to the repository.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
The issue number.
The title of the issue.
The body of the issue.
The creator of the issue
The state of the issue.
The person assigned to fix the issue.
The datetime in UTC when the task was created.
The datetime when the issue was last updated.
The datetime when the issue was closed.
The ID of the repository this issue is linked.
Table containing a list of all the organizations.
This is the key used internally by DataMiner to identify the table entries.
The ID used by GitHub to identify the organization.
The description for the organization
The url the the avatar of the organization.
Indicates if the repositories under this origanization should be polled.

Param.Name: OrganizationsTrackRepositories
Param.Message:
This will enable/disable tracking of all the repositories under this organization. When enabling it will also start polling all the repositories. When disabling it will remove all the repositories under this organization.
Are you sure you want to continue.

Information.Subtext: Poll Manager
Internal DataMiner Table key.
Name of the API request to that polls certain requests.
Poll Manager Poll State
Poll Manager Poll Frequency
Poll Manager Last Polled
Poll Manager Manual Refresh action.
Poll Manager Polled before last attempt (PID21005)

Changes.Change: Changed the way the context menu works. Now you can more easily add/remove repos from automation scripts

Changes.NewFeature: Added workflows table to the connector.
Added option to track all the repositories under an organization
Added a way to create automation scripts workflows
